programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Thrill of a Kitty and the Agony of Smoked Meat
programme.desc: Darrell aims to prove that treasure sometimes looks like total trash, while Rene won't be content with second best.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and the Old Man try to buy one of America's most valuable race cars - a 1965 Shelby Cobra - and become interested in a clock from a Second World War ship.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Old Man faces a tough decision when the shop is offered a bottle of Prohibition-era whiskey, Corey buys a hot-air balloon, and a customer tries to sell a classic guitar.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley smells cannabis smoke in the warehouse and tries to find the culprit, while Les puts out a cash reward for information.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has the opportunity to get his hands on truck loads of brand new goods that could change the store for ever.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick examines a 1920s chainsaw and an unusual golf ball dispenser.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Brettly returns from his first solo picking trip with an impressive haul, and Rick asks a former client to help him work out how a 1930s iron lung works.

programme.title: Motives & Murders
programme.desc: The murder of 29-year-old Renee Rondeau, who was found strangled in the bathroom of her Lakeview apartment the day after Halloween in 1994. Three years later, Andre Griggs and Benita Johnson were convicted of the crime.

programme.title: Motives & Murders
programme.desc: Detectives discuss their hunt for a murderer, rapist and master of disguise, who dressed in female attire to get into women's homes.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers bid for some scruffy looking lockers, but appearances prove deceptive as the most unattractive units turn out to contain the most valuable contents.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: If I Were a Tibetin' Man
programme.desc: The bidders compete for a potentially profitable furniture locker, while Ricky and Bubba buy a collection of American football autographs, but need to check if they are genuine.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Documentary investigating what makes locations such as US nuclear missile bases such a magnet for UFOs.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Experts investigate military bunkers in the US where, according to some, living extraterrestrials are being hidden.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the truth about UFOs, investigating whether a covert manual could prove the US government is hiding extra-terrestrial secrets.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank visit rural Minnesota, where they meet antiques collectors and examine vintage peep show machines.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank rummage around a machine shop in search of rare collectibles.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The price of gold begins to fall, and the staff worry that they could end up losing money. Les, Seth and Ashley become more conscious of what items they buy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les offers to buy a diamond-encrusted watch from a customer. He makes sure his jewellery expert takes a close look, having been stung by a similar deal previously.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The price of gold continues to drop. Seth suggests they should review their purchases, and sort out the cluttered sales floor, along with a warehouse overloaded with junk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth is angered when Les dismisses the consultant's suggestions about improving business practices. Seth disappears, and his manager fears he may be on the verge of quitting.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les confronts Seth after finding out that he was at Bill's pawn shop. He asks some blunt questions about why he would betray the family by visiting a rival store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: On the last day of the Dream Cruise, Les buys what is claimed to be the world's largest fishing lure - reportedly an art piece saluting Michigan - for $3,000

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley smells cannabis smoke in the warehouse and tries to find the culprit, while Les puts out a cash reward for information.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has the opportunity to get his hands on truck loads of brand new goods that could change the store for ever.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team has a chance to buy what is claimed to be an authentic bullwhip used in an Indiana Jones film, and handles a document dating from colonial times, signed by 18th-century American statesman John Hancock.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers consider buying their first aeroplane, and scrutinise a map of colonial Boston, unsure whether it is counterfeit. Elsewhere, Rick Harrison is unimpressed when Chumlee purchases a piece of fake art.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick is embarrassed when a woman tries to sell her husband's Playboy collection, and Corey considers buying a crossbow that has not been fired in almost 40 years.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers are tempted to buy a 1979 Kiss pinball machine, and Rick is stumped when a woman brings in a 1914 $20 bill with an unusual serial number. Chumlee tries to scrape together the cash to purchase a classic Harley-Davidson Shovel-head motorbike before the Old Man sells it.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team considers buying a mysterious 17th-century treasure chest that no one has yet managed to open.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff are offered an aeroplane propeller linked to aviator Charles Lindbergh, and a key ring alleged to have belonged to singer Willie Nelson.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and the Old Man try to buy one of America's most valuable race cars - a 1965 Shelby Cobra - and become interested in a clock from a Second World War ship.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Old Man faces a tough decision when the shop is offered a bottle of Prohibition-era whiskey, Corey buys a hot-air balloon, and a customer tries to sell a classic guitar.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee produces 'pawn shop pinot' using a 19th-century winemaker, and Rick inspects a lorry that looks set to become the priciest item to enter the business.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team procures a quilt made from celebrity autographs, and a Sweeney Todd-style barber's chair arrives at the store.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: A UFO Spotted Over the Pentagon and More
programme.desc: Footage of a pyramid-shaped UFO over the Pentagon, a spook haunting a playground, and strange creatures stalking California.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Experts investigate evidence of spirits and frightening paranormal encounters, questioning whether ghosts and poltergeists exist or are a figment of wild imagination.

programme.title: The Curse of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: Treasure hunter Marty Lagina learns of a mystery that even rivals that of Oak Island when he meets fellow Michigan native Kevin Dykstra. Kevin believes he's found a trail to a fortune in confederate gold that lies at the bottom of Lake Michigan - but needs Marty's help to get it.

programme.title: Pirate Traders
programme.desc: Cameras follow treasure hunters the Pirates Inc on high-pressure and often dangerous missions to retrieve and sell valuable items left behind by drug traffickers. In this episode, the team heads to Belize to find a plane when the pilot is jailed.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Comedy series starring real-life married couple Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together. In the first episode, the Richardsons decide to throw a huge birthday party for their daughter, Elsie.

credits.actor: Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs divulge what sound like tall tales about themselves, before their rival contestants decide whether they are lying. Greg Davies takes Lee Mack's place as guest captain, and joining him and David Mitchell are choir leader Gareth Malone, Sherlock actress Amanda Abbington, comedian and Buzzcocks panellist Phill Jupitus and Pointless co-host Richard Osman.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts a 2011 edition of the comedy quiz, with guests Chris Addison, Stewart Francis and Ava Vidal joining panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Seann Walsh to offer opinions on world events.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs try to call each other's bluff with a few stories about themselves that might be true or might be out-and-out porkies. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are comedians Jo Brand, Roisin Conaty and Paul Foot, and TV wildlife presenter Ray Mears.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: The comic holds court over real-life disputes, featuring an extra who is costing his friend acting work. Plus, rappers Harvey and Romeo argue over lyrics copyrights.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: The 'judge' is faced with mediating a dispute in his own family, while two Yorkshire wrestlers fight it out in court.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Actress Chizzy Akudolu, author and comedian Charlie Higson, historian Kate Williams and comedian Tom Allen take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Multi-terrain board sports push Tim and Gendle to their limits, including high speed slaloms and an attempt at the world's first dry ski loop the loop.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Hurricane Man
programme.desc: Josh races to get into position with film-maker Caroline as Hurricane Willa barrels towards Sinaloa in western Mexico, while James faces an agonising decision over his own safety.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Kia Cee'd through a rigorous but peculiar road test featuring eels, curry, a rock legend, an American police officer and an unusual game of rugby involving James May. Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the Mastretta MXT, but worries about the repercussions of a comment he made in a previous episode about Mexico, the sports car's country of manufacture. Plus, three high-performance hatchbacks are driven with gusto around the test track, and Formula One driver Lewis Hamilton gets a second chance to smash the lap record.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Lucas and Adam visit a huge collection of military items and vehicles just outside of Melbourne.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Barry, Darren and Scotty get up front and personal, while Boudicca and Linda go nose to nose over an uplifting prize. Meanwhile, John gives Nat a hard time for blind bidding.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Linda needs help shifting some heavy gear in Carmarthen, but it remains to be seen whether Scotty will help out. Sean Kelly presents.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike takes an epic Route 66 road trip in an antique convertible to return it to the widow of its previous owner.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Staffordshire Police officers encounter a man who fancies some late-night shopping in Stoke, smashing his way through a shop front with an axe.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Complaints by neighbours about anti-social behaviour leads to a raid on a suspected drugs den in Burton. Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Steve and Tim head up the night shift as they deal with an array of inebriated locals in Burton. Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A refugee from war-torn Venezuela tells officers how she paid human traffickers to smuggle her through Central America and to the Mexico-United States border. In Laredo, an American couple caught smuggling methamphetamine inside cans of vegetables crumble while being questioned and give officers information about a chain of so-called 'stash houses' where drugs and illegal immigrants are being kept.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In a first for the show, James May shocks the rest of the team when he puts his foot firmly on the accelerator of a Bugatti Veyron. Meanwhile, a case of bad driving and appalling trousers results in all three presenters getting thrown off a golf course. Actor Hugh Grant is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Pro driver Shane Lynch allows engineer Ralph Hosier and his teams four days in the scrapyard to build two vehicles that then go against Shane's Audi R8 V10 in a duel test of acceleration and braking.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner welcomes Pointless co-host Richard Osman, broadcaster Joan Bakewell and comedian Roisin Conaty to discuss their pet hates, in the hope of having them banished to Room 101. Their gripes include Bambi, chewing gum and cobblers.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: German comedian Henning Wehn, West End star Michael Ball and actress-presenter Caroline Quentin reveal their pet hates to Frank Skinner, in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Things that really get on the guests' nerves this week include fundraising, clairvoyants and junk mail.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: TV presenter Vernon Kay, interior designer and Dragons' Den entrepreneur Kelly Hoppen, and comedian and actor Miles Jupp compete to have their pet hates banished on the lively panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include litter louts, toilet-roll covers and loud noises.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy play hot-tub fantasy date with Anna and Toby - and soon find themselves landing in hot water. One-time Spice Girl Emma Bunton and Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent appear as themselves, alongside regulars Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee faces a parenting dilemma as he worries that son Charlie is getting a reputation at school for being the class clown. But is it a simple case of the old adage 'like father, like son'? Sally Bretton co-stars, alongside Hugh Dennis and Selina Griffiths.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy decide to attend a marriage counselling session. However, events soon put their relationship under further strain. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Angela Barnes, Guz Khan, Tom Davis and Harriet Kemsley are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Jo Brand hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedy actress and writer Diane Morgan and Countdown host Nick Hewer joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news stories.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Unusual rail networks designed to traverse water, including the Indian Ocean, the earthquake zones of the Bosphorus Strait and the sea cliffs of the Italian Riviera.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: The Wieliczka Salt mine in southern Poland, some 327 metres deep, where the voids left behind from excavating salt have been transformed into extraordinary spaces, carved by hand.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A profile of Hermann Goering - the dashing, young, down-on-his-luck war veteran who turned into an extravagant, heartless, obese, drug-addled Nazi billionaire.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: A look at the planet's most incredible metropolitan railways, and how they help people solve distinctly urban problems. Including a project to upgrade New York's transit system..

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: Ronnie Kray and the Pervert Peer
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, the Kray twins rose from small-time racketeers to head the most powerful criminal organisation London had ever seen. This documentary about the affinity between the upper echelons of society and the criminal underclass reveals how they built their empire on fear, violence and extortion - as well as Ronnie's alleged homosexual relationship with a prominent Tory peer.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Ffestiniog and Welsh Highland Railway are celebrating their annual Victorian Weekend, while in south Devon, silver service waiter Andy Leech runs the three-course Sunday lunch.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: On the Welsh Highland Railway, a newly built Pullman carriage is on its way to Caernarfon Station and a Saddle Tank Loco is being completely restored on the East Lancashire Railway.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: The remains of three U-boats discovered in the Bristol Channel. Their exact identity and how they came to be there is not known, so divers explore the wrecks and with the help of British and German experts reveal the mystery submarines. Series investigating deep-sea wrecks off the south-west coast of England.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: The fate of a Canadian warship that went to the aid of an American freighter rocked by an explosion in 1944. More than 60 years on, divers uncover new evidence of the sinking.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough focuses on animals living in deserts. Cameras explore the dry Atacama of Chile, where guanacos survive by licking dew off cacti, and capture the rare sight of wild camels eating snow to stay hydrated on Mongolia's Gobi plains. In the rocky Namibian desert, elephants desperately search for food and lions wander the wilderness hunting oryx.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Camera crews follow the activities of wildlife in the Arctic and Antarctic, including an emperor penguin colony's nine-month migration across sea ice to its breeding ground. The team also takes aerial and underwater shots to capture humpback whales feeding and tracks a male polar bear as it swims 100km to find new ice from which to hunt seals.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough focuses on animals living in deserts. Cameras explore the dry Atacama of Chile, where guanacos survive by licking dew off cacti, and capture the rare sight of wild camels eating snow to stay hydrated on Mongolia's Gobi plains. In the rocky Namibian desert, elephants desperately search for food and lions wander the wilderness hunting oryx.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Camera crews follow the activities of wildlife in the Arctic and Antarctic, including an emperor penguin colony's nine-month migration across sea ice to its breeding ground. The team also takes aerial and underwater shots to capture humpback whales feeding and tracks a male polar bear as it swims 100km to find new ice from which to hunt seals.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Punk and new wave music, including vintage sessions by the Clash, Joy Division, the Buzzcocks, X-Ray Spex, the Damned and the Undertones.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: America's punk and new wave era in the 1970s, featuring acts including Alice Cooper, the New York Dolls, Iggy Pop, the Ramones and Bruce Springsteen.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Archive performances by post-punk acts including Ian Dury and the Blockheads, the Police, Simple Minds and Madness.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: The late 1960s saw the first regular transmission of colour television, and the music world followed the trend with the launch of BBC television show Colour Me Pop. This episode features some of the programme's highlights, including performances by the Who, the Kinks, the Small Faces, the Bonzo Dog Doo-Dah Band and the Jimi Hendrix Experience.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: The documentary uncovering the hidden history of Britain continues with the story of the department store Selfridges, looking at the ways it changed the country's shopping habits. Plus, an examination of the life of Mr Selfridge himself.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look through the corridors of power in 10 of the most opulent and historic royal residences on Earth.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Chris Tarrant on the Polar Express
programme.desc: Chris sets out to reach the northernmost railway station on Earth, inside Russia's Arctic Circle. This is an epic 2,000-mile adventure from Moscow into Arctic Siberia, and begins with a marathon 19-hour leg. Along the way he enjoys a reindeer stew with a local family and takes the controls of one of the massive locomotives that power the trains, before pressing on along railways built under the brutal regime of Joseph Stalin.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: When a skull is found buried in concrete in a church crypt, Boyd seeks to uncover who it belongs to and why it is there, but gets little help from the Church authorities, who seem focused on obscuring the facts. The discovery of another body, adorned with ritualistic symbols, leads the team to a suspicious workman and an uncooperative retired priest. Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston star in a feature-length episode, with guest appearances by Annette Crosbie and Barry Morse.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team is called to a terrible motorway accident. Elsewhere, Bayleaf realizes that Karen has kidnapped Melanie. Starring James Hazeldine.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie makes a quick trip to London with Lexie and a cargo of grouse to prepare a special Highland dinner at his restaurant, and a helicopter and an ice-cream van contribute to a disaster. Dawn Steele and Alastair Mackenzie star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: The annual St Peter's Fair gets under way in Shrewsbury but a gruesome murder dampens the festivities. Antagonism between local merchants and visiting traders becomes increasingly ugly, and as civil unrest rages in the streets, Beringar is ordered to kill his friend Cadfael, whose investigations are causing King Stephen acute political embarrassment. Medieval whodunit, starring Derek Jacobi, Eoin McCarthy and Michael Culver.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Eric gets involved with an Irish rock band, while Lovejoy takes to the water with Lady Jane's friend Victoria Cavero and bravely pops the question - only to receive an unexpected response. Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton and Chris Jury star with guests Joanna Lumley and the members of Hothouse Flowers.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Lady Jane persuades Lovejoy to act as driver for an old friend who has to attend her sea-faring brother's burial. The roguish antiques dealer is given the job of selling the late captain's Second World War medals, and there is a smart fashion photographer who wants them. However, some drunken sailors then come into the picture and Lovejoy finds himself dealing with the gun-toting Italian Angelo Pantaloni. Light-hearted drama, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Back on English soil after his recent escapades in France, Sharpe is assigned to restore peace in the north, where the local aristocracy's corrupt and high-handed ways have led to mutterings of rebellion among the poor. And as the unrest grows, he's forced to decide where his true loyalties lie. Feature-length adventure, starring Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley, Abigail Cruttenden, and Caroline Langrishen.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Seven - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. The motley crew pulls together as Barry's renovation finally begins to take shape, and Oz uses his head to get Dennis out of trouble with local hardcase Ally Fraser. Comedy drama, starring Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The brickies arrive in sleepy Derbyshire to convert Thornley Manor into timeshare holiday homes for dodgy property dealer Ally Fraser. However, an eagle-eyed local lady becomes suspicious of the gang and decides to investigate further.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: When their lead suspect is murdered in a laboratory, Peregrine and James are forced to admit that their killer's motives go far deeper than they had both dared to consider.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Flambeau enlists Fr Brown's help to steal the Queen's coronation gift from the Pope. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Lady Felicia's reckless driving lands her in the next hospital bed to Mrs McCarthy - with a killer on the loose. Mystery, starring Nancy Carroll and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The Frog and Cheetah's publican Ray Neilson branches out into tourism with a Lord of the Rings-themed attraction. Shortly afterwards his wife is discovered dead under a giant foam spider, apparently killed by an improbably powerful dose of poison from New Zealand's only native venomous spider. Suspicion soon falls on Ray and local arachnologist Chandra Singh.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: When the criminal who murdered Detective Watts' brother is released, Watts kills him. Discrepancies in his statement lead Murdoch to suspect that he took justice into his own hands.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Gene is convinced a bomb warning in Manchester is part of a campaign by the IRA and plans to investigate the Irish locals. The team's respect for Sam is shaken when his 21st-century investigation methods put them at risk, but he insists the link is too obvious and tries to open his boss's eyes to the benefits of good community relations.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Gene fears a serial killer he brought to justice in the 1960s has resurfaced after a woman's body is found. The victim's resemblance to a family member triggers childhood memories for Sam, who goes undercover in middle-class suburbia to investigate. Drama, guest starring former Coronation Street actresses Eva Pope and Georgia Taylor, with Philip Glenister and John Simm.

credits.actor: former Coronation Street actresses Eva Pope

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Julia is assigned a compensation case brought by a man who has sustained spinal and brain damage in an accident at work, and tries to persuade Kavanagh to lead her. Unfortunately, he already has his hands full with a tricky compensation case and son Matt's attempts to get the better of him. John Thaw stars, with Ned Sherrin, Frances Tomelty and TP McKenna.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: The panel members debate more of the big issues the whole country is talking about.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: It's Movie Week as the remaining celebrities and their partners battle it out to stay in the competition and secure a place in the semi-final. Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean head up the ice panel, alongside Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman, and there's a performance from Luke Evans alongside the professional skaters. Hosted by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: The Lake District - The Borrowdale Walk
programme.desc: Setting off from Rosthwaite, a small village in the jaws of Borrowdale, the expert walker takes in the history and landscape of the Cumbrian fells as she heads up the small peak Castle Crag, which stands at less than 1,000ft. The presenter is joined by celebrated mountaineer Chris Bonington, to whom she asks - which is better - Everest or Castle Crag? From the lush green valley floor to magnificent views over Derwent Water, this walk is a great way to take home a lasting memory of the Lake District, and all in under three hours.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Part one of two. International Rescue faces their most dangerous mission ever when Tracy Island comes under attack. Guest starring Lee Majors (The Six Million Dollar Man).

credits.actor: Lee Majors (The Six Million Dollar Man)

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny takes on one of the UK's toughest obstacle courses, but can he beat the clock and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo is thinks is out trick-or-treating for Halloween. But he unwittingly robs a bank instead of Weasel..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo is a part-time firefighter reservist whose rescue mission for the day is to save a cat in a tree. In reality, the cat is none other than Fizz..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Thinking he is in the middle of a work-out at his local gym, Magoo inadvertently climbs onto a delivery boy's bicycle..

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean breaks his bed using it as a trampoline. He tries to fix it, but he can't. Next morning, he goes to buy a brand-new bed..

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.sub-title: Innervasion Part 2: Call the Dream Police

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by actor Greg Wise. Chefs Clare Smyth and Lenny Carr-Roberts are on hand to provide the food, while chocolatier Ali Popechocolatier Ali Pope whips up some tasty treats. Plus, Oz Clarke has more wine expertise to share, offering tips on buying Fairtrade.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up a spicy jackfruit chilli, followed by their vegan friendly, gooey camembert hedgehog bread, mezze layer cake and chocolate mousse. Their guest is food writer Anna Jones, who demonstrates her carrot and sesame pancakes.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: The final two diets to be put through their paces are the TwoChubbyCubs Diet in which fakeaways' are on the menu, and the trendy Collagen Diet, in which a bone broth plan claims to keep you fuller for longer. Sian Williams and Dr Ranj Singh present.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team turn a suburban plot in Hull into a wildlife retreat for a nature-loving teenager and his family. Plus, tips on creating a pond that is attractive to animals and safe for children, the best small trees to screen an overlooked garden, and a guide putting together an outdoor cinema.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Two couples disappear in the tiny village of Monks Barton amid rumours of witchcraft and haunted woods. As Barnaby and Jones investigate, psychic Cyrus LeVanu clashes with cleric Wallace Stone over their different methods of 'healing' the woods, while other locals seem to be caught up in a stolen antiques racket. When a body is unearthed and the death toll rises, the detectives race to catch the killer by finding a connection between the missing couples and the thefts. Anton Lesser guest stars, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking Strictly Come Dancing professional Oti Mabuse, tennis coach Judy Murray and actor-comedian John Thomson to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. One of them will make it through to the Super Catchphrase round, where they could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo's entertainment show, featuring undercover pranks, surprises galore and star guests. In this week's show, Ant and Dec are joined in the studio by Rob Brydon, who takes up the role of Star Guest Announcer, while Anne-Marie will be taking to the stage to perform in the End Of The Show Show. Plus, lucky viewers across the UK are surprised with a Place On The Plane and another audience member gets the chance to Win The Ads, and get their hands on every single item featured in the commercial breaks.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the second episode of the Battle rounds. Coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor all return to their infamous red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions go head to head and fight for their place on their coach's team. The singers that impress their coach the most remain in the competition, but those that aren't so lucky can still be stolen by another coach.

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven (2016)
programme.desc: A remote frontier town falls under the control of a ruthless industrialist, who uses the locals as forced labour in his mines. A woman goes in search of help, recruiting a band of seven hired guns to protect the town and train the people to fight back. Remake of the classic Western, starring Denzel Washington and Chris Pratt.

programme.desc: We're all about good times and good tunes! Get in the party mood as we rewind the ultimate party tunes to get you on the dancefloor.

programme.title: World's Greatest...Collabs! Top 25
programme.desc: We celebrate the merits of teamwork with this century's biggest and best hook-ups, including RiRi and Calvin, Gaga and Beyonce, Pharrell and Daft Punk, plus Pitbull and everyone.

programme.title: The Showdown: Calvin Vs Sigala
programme.desc: Two of dance music's biggest stars Calvin Harris & Sigala go head to head in a showdown of their biggest hits! Will Calvin give you the 'Feels'? Or will you have 'Easy Love' for Sigala?.

programme.title: That's My Jam: 00s Throwback 50
programme.desc: This is your Jam!. Here's our pick of the most banging noughties videos you love.

programme.title: The Saturday Hotmix!
programme.desc: An exclusive, non-stop mix of the hottest songs to soundtrack your Saturday evening!.

programme.title: Hit After Hit
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits by your favourite stars back to back.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The manufacturing documentary reveals how a classic British bike is being rebooted in India, and how radiation is used to beat art fraud.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China wrap their American journey with a look at the best of the US, highlighting their favourite moments in and out of the stateside shop.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Mark prepares a massive load travelling from South Australia all the way to a tiny island in Micronesia. Plus, Mick transports a curious giraffe through Sydney traffic.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Orange County Choppers team designs a custom motorbike for an outdoor lifestyle company, and are inspired to test their survival skills in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Ian wants a 1956 'baby bird' restomod that drives like a sports car. Dan has the perfect solution - a GTO-Thunderbird combo that drives like a bat out of hell.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe helps tag, worm and castrate a flock of sheep, and uses a diamond-bladed saw on a concrete wall.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The making of pewter flasks, potato salad and hydrogen fuel cells, and how technology has influenced their production.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Canvas Wall Tents/Peace Pipes/Shredded Wheat Cereal/Cannons
programme.desc: The manufacture of items including canvas wall tents, peace pipes and cannons, and how processes have developed over the years.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Sig gives Jack a Whiplash-style captaining lesson on the Northwestern, and Captain Johnathan's catch is threatened by a long trip and a prank on the Time Bandit.

programme.title: Alaska Mega Machines
programme.desc: Engineers on the Alaskan island of Sitka construct a colossal dam capable of powering an entire town. Plus, Alaska's biggest boat lift hauls a 400-ton fishing ship.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer searches for a Ferrari 308 GT4 within his budget, and when he secures one hopes that Edd China is up to the task of restoring it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer buys a 1974 Ferrari Dino, but has to wait for Edd China to restore it before he can sell it on for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer visits Idaho to buy a Karmann Ghia, but a broken gearbox and damaged interior could stop him and Edd China from making a profit on the sale of the restored vehicle.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Porsche 914 in a barn and thinks he can turn a profit on the 1970s sports car. Edd China has the tricky job of restoring it to a saleable condition.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds an unregistered Cobra sports car that has only 1,000 miles on its clock, but expert mechanic Edd China faces a difficult challenge to get it to pass a tough emissions test.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Poland where he tries to bag a Lamborghini Urraco. However, the prices being asked might be in breach of his budget.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer seeks out a Porsche 912E, and with help from Edd China, he aims to address the years of neglect and make a return on his investment.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: The team discovers a documented Nazi presence and an underground U-Boat base in the Canary Islands, and contemplates whether Hitler may have stopped there on his way to South America.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: After a tragic event on their way to a Guarani village, the team secures vital information from the village elders about a special stone hidden near the 'Demon Falls'.

programme.title: Expedition Mungo
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Paul 'Mungo' Mungeam heads to Peru to capture on film the legendary yacumama - a snake so feared by villagers that they have tried to blow it up with dynamite.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie team the Young Guns have a life-threatening moment hunting legendary pineapple opal. The Cooke Bros scramble to hunt on another miner's claim for a share of the find.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer plans to capitalise on 1980s nostalgia by restoring an original 1982 Toyota Supra, and Ant Anstead works to bring this 35-year-old car into the modern era.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Tom seeks expert help to save one of his ancient hedgerows. Meanwhile, Ian has a loose pig on his hands when one of them escapes during weigh-in and Ally runs out of storage.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard makes a startling find at a 13th-century house in the Lake District. Later, he visits a classic car collector in Hertfordshire.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: Colin Murray presents a round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Hull City v Leeds United and West Bromwich Albion v Wigan Athletic.

programme.title: Formula E
programme.desc: Action from the Marrakesh ePrix.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: The crimes of Hannegret Donnelly, who battered husband Christopher to death with 78 visible injuries in Aylesbury, Buckinghamshire. In court, it transpired she had been abusing him at home for years.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How, with no finger prints at the scene, detectives turned to cutting-edge forensic techniques to track a callous killer, hoping to land their man before he could strike again.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: The case of the Atlanta socialite Lita McClinton, who was shot dead in 1987 just hours before her divorce hearing, and exploring whether her husband was to blame.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of Alabama church woman Dorothy Leatherwood. Rumours in the neighbourhood saw detectives struggle to separate fact from fiction.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Atlanta Prison riots of November 1987, which broke out when the US struck a deal with Cuba to repatriate up to 2,500 refugees held at the facility. The uprising lasted 11 days, involved more than 100 hostages, and saw a substantial portion of the prison destroyed by fire.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Emergency animal medical technicians come to the rescue of 17 emaciated pigs.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Alex needs to find out what is wrong with a dog struggling with a heatwave. A pregnant guinea pig is being watched closely, while Dr Kate helps a baby wombat.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Julie and her mother cannot hold back when it comes to their brutal opinions, while brides-to-be Joy and Beth have high expectations.
